content: Introduce a minimum-diversity constraint on each template: every template must include at least three distinct variations. That is, it is no longer allowed for a template to contain only a single variation occupying all slots. All original template design constraints (slot fill, demand fulfillment, symmetry-breaking, and production ordering) must still be satisfied.
value_info: `n_slots`: The number of slots per template, given as an integer.
`n_templates`: The number of templates, given as an integer.
`n_var`: The number of design variations, given as an integer.
`demand`: A list of integers of size `n_var`, giving the required number of units for each design variation.

var1.descr: `layout`: A 2D list of integers of size `[n_templates x n_var]`, where `layout[i][v]` is the number of slots on template `i` allocated to variation `v`.

var2.descr: `production`: A list of integers of size `n_templates`, where `production[i]` is the number of times template `i` is printed.
